title: Task 49

question.text: What does the expert mean by don't skip breakfast and you probably compensate later?

answers.answer: Avoid missing breakfast as you might eat more later to make up for it
Always have a large breakfast and a small lunch
answers.feedback: The focus is on not skipping breakfast and the tendency to eat more later, not necessarily on meal sizes.

answers.answer: Skip breakfast to save time in the morning
answers.feedback: The expert advises against skipping breakfast, not recommending it.

answers.answer: Eat the same amount of food at every meal
answers.feedback: Compensating later suggests changing how much you eat, not eating the same amount.

dialogue.text: Another thing: don't skip breakfast. Breakfast gives you the energy to start the day.
If you skip it, you probably compensate later by eating too much or you feel sluggish in the morning.

description:
The verb to skip means to not do or not include something that you usually do or that should be done.

Compensate means to make up for something that is missed or lacking. It's often used to describe actions taken to balance out an absence or deficiency. For example:

If you skip lunch, you might compensate by eating more at dinner. (not having lunch and then eating more later to make up for it)
